-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVHealth_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;
var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVDuplicateVM_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;
var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVVirtualSwitches_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;
var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVSnapshot_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVOverCommitment_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;
var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVVMHealth_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-BlackoutTimesEventDelta.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVVMHealth_String_BlackoutTimesEventDelta$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-Hostname.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVVMM_String_Hostname$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVVMM_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-Username.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVVMM_String_Username$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

78.description:
A list of states which will return `Ok` if being present. States not inside
the list will return `Critical`
78.caption: VMMState

10.description: Allows to throw warning in case the Hyper-V cluster node count is not matching this threshold
10.caption: NodeCountWarning

63.description: Include only virtual machines that are currently running
63.caption: ActiveVms

30.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin. Default to FALSE.
30.caption: NoPerfData

49.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
49.caption: Verbosity

62.description: Exclude virtual machines with a specific name. Supports wildcard usage (*)
62.caption: ExcludeVms

22.description: Used to specify a WARNING threshold for the Hyper-V RAM overcommitment in Byte.
22.caption: RAMOCByteWarn

13.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
13.caption: Verbosity

47.description:
Overrides the default behaviour of the plugin in case no virtual machine is present on the system.
Instead of returning `Unknown` the plugin will return `Ok` instead if this argument is set.
47.caption: AvoidEmptyCheck

71.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
71.caption: Verbosity

77.description: List of hosts to be excluded from the check output for checking
77.caption: ExcludeHost

73.description: The VMM host to check against
73.caption: Hostname

68.description: Skips the current virtual machine heartbeat status check.
68.caption: SkipVMHeartbeat

12.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
12.caption: NoPerfData

65.description:
Allows to monitor on how many active VM's are currently present and throws a
warning in case it is within the threshold
65.caption: CriticalActiveVms

40.description:
Warning threshold for each individual vms total snapshots size. It is also possible to
enter e.g. 10% as threshold value, if you want a percentage comparison. Defaults to (B)
40.caption: TotalSnapshotSizeWarning

14.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
14.caption: ThresholdInterval

26.description: Used to specify a WARNING threshold for the Hyper-V Storage overcommitment in Byte.
26.caption: StorageOCByteWarn

17.description: Include only virtual machines that are currently running
17.caption: ActiveVms

28.description: Used to specify a WARNING threshold for the Hyper-V average Storage overcommitment.
28.caption: StorageOCPercentWarn

76.description: List of hosts to be included within the check output for checking
76.caption: IncludeHost

36.description: Warning threshold for each individual vms how many snapshots they may have.
36.caption: CountSnapshotWarning

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

50.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
50.caption: ThresholdInterval

45.description: Critical threshold for predicting the size of snapshots taken for each Vm before the partition becomes full.
45.caption: SnapshotSizePredictionCritical

60.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.

38.description: Warning threshold for each individual vms snapshots, how old they must be in seconds.
38.caption: CreationTimeWarning

23.description: Used to specify a CRITICAL threshold for the Hyper-V RAM overcommitment in Byte.
23.caption: RAMOCByteCrit

51.description: With this parameter you can filter virtual switches for the check in. e.g. testswitch1, testswitch1.
51.caption: Include

20.description: Warning threshold for Hyper-V average CPU overcommitment.
20.caption: CPUOCPercentWarn

59.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
59.caption: Verbosity

69.description: Critical threshold for the Hyper-V VM current status
69.caption: VmEnabledState

54.description: Only the external virtual switches are added to the check.
54.caption: External

66.description:
Defines a time range (example "-5d") to filter for any BlackoutTime log entries older than the provided time range.
In case a warning BlackoutTime is triggered and older than the provided threshold, the value is printed with an "OK" state
instead of "WARNING"
66.caption: BlackoutTimesEventDelta

57.description:
Overrides the default behaviour of the plugin in case no virtual switch is present on the system.
Instead of returning `Unknown` the plugin will return `Ok` instead if this argument is set.
57.caption: AvoidEmptyCheck

43.description: Critical threshold for each individual vms snapshot size in Byte.
43.caption: SnapshotSizeCritical

80.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])

8.description:

0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state

41.description:
Critical threshold for each individual vms total snapshots size. It is also possible to

5.description: Allows to filter for virtual machines which are included in the check. All others are dropped
5.caption: IncludeVMs

72.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.

11.description: Allows to throw critical in case the Hyper-V cluster node count is not matching this threshold
11.caption: NodeCountCritical
